Class Database

java.lang.Object
Database
public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
Contains all the information and methods necessary to write to and manipulate a database

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database()

  • Method Details

    • setTable

      public static void setTable​(java.lang.String table)
      sets table to the inputted string
      Parameters:
      table - desired table

    • getKeyInfo

      public static void getKeyInfo() throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      sets parameter keyInfo to the information read in from the key file
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown if the key file is not found

    • validLogin

      public static boolean validLogin​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Determines if the inputted username password combo is valid by checking if it is in the login database
      Parameters:
      username - the username being checked
      password - the password being checked
      Returns:
      true if the login is valid, false if not
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to check database info
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown if failed to get info from key file

    • addAccount

      public static boolean addAccount​(java.lang.String usernameInp, java.lang.String passwordInp) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Adds an account to the database, specifically the login and accounts table. Unless you're testing, then it only adds to test table. Only adds account if the username is not taken
      Parameters:
      usernameInp - username of account to add
      passwordInp - password of account to add
      Returns:
      true if added successfully, false if username is already being used
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if database failed to add row

    • addToTournament

      public static boolean addToTournament​(java.lang.String usernameInp, java.lang.String tournamentTable) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Adds a user to a tournament table
      Parameters:
      usernameInp - the username to be added to the tournament table
      tournamentTable - the tournament table to be added to
      Returns:
      true if the account was added successfully, false if the username is already taken in the table
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • removeFromTournament

      public static boolean removeFromTournament​(java.lang.String usernameInp, java.lang.String tournamentTable) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Removes a row/user from a tournament table
      Parameters:
      usernameInp - the row/user to be removed
      tournamentTable - the table the user is being removed from
      Returns:
      true if removed successfully, false if there is no account with the inputted username in the table
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • createTournament

      public static boolean createTournament​(java.lang.String tableName, java.lang.String timeStarted) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates a tournament table with columns for the username, wins, and games left of the players in the tournament. Also writes the tournament name and time started to the mastertournament table, which keeps track of all tournaments
      Parameters:
      tableName - name of the tournament/table
      timeStarted - the time the tournament started
      Returns:
      true if table was created successfully, false if a tournament with the same name is being used
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • deleteTournament

      public static boolean deleteTournament​(java.lang.String tableName) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Deletes a tournament table. Also removes this tournament's row from the mastertournament table
      Parameters:
      tableName - name of the tournament/table to be deleted
      Returns:
      true if deleted successfully, false if there is no tournament table with the inputted name
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • getInfo

      public static java.lang.String[] getInfo​(java.lang.String username) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Returns info from the row corresponding to the inputted username. Be sure to set the desired table in advance. If the table is mastertournament, the username parameter is ignored and all information from mastertournament is outputted
      Parameters:
      username - the account where information will be gotten from
      Returns:
      String array containing account information (ex: if the table is set to "Login", [username, password (encrypted)])
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • getUserData

      public static java.lang.String[] getUserData​(java.lang.String tournament) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Returns all the data from an inputted tournament table
      Parameters:
      tournament - the tournament name/table where information will be gotten from
      Returns:
      String array containing all the data from the tournament table
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • deleteAccount

      public static boolean deleteAccount​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Removes account from tables. If not testing, removes from Accounts and Login. If testing, only removes from Test. Validates that the username password combo is valid
      Parameters:
      username - username of account to be deleted
      password - password of account to be deleted
      Returns:
      true account deleted successfully, false if username password combo invalid
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • update

      public static void update​(java.lang.String[] data) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Updates a row of a table. Be sure to call setTable() beforehand to update the desired table. Data represents what you would like the row to change to. The indexes correspond to the table's column
      Parameters:
      data - the new row information
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • getTopPlayers

      public static java.lang.String[] getTopPlayers​(int num) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Returns an array in this format [user1,score1,user2,score2,...] where the user and their corresponding score are in descending order (i.e. index 0 is the username for the player with the highest score, index 1 is their highest score) should specify table before running (Accounts.setTable())
      Parameters:
      num - the number of users in the table to return, if zero, returns all users
      Returns:
      String array containing user information
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • clearAll

      public static void clearAll() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Clears all rows from a table. Be sure to call setTable() beforehand
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - thrown if failed to write to database

    • initialize

      public static void initialize​(java.lang.String table)
      Creates a connection with the database. Calls getKeyInfo. Sets table to the inputted table
      Parameters:
      table - the desired table to be worked with
